title: Can we do something about the endless amount of people entering ranked who are not ready...
body:
Honestly I get tons of people who have like less than 100 games played entering ranked and playing with or against me and they have absolutely no fucking idea what they are doing. 
Its not fair to me, is not fair to my team, its not fair to the enemy team and its especially not fair to the new player. 
9 times out of a 10 a fresh level 30 will not even be up to a silver level of play unless they are A) a smurf or B) have moba experience.

replies.body:
Doubtful lol. I'd say Your Average fresh 30 is bronze. Assuming he hasn't played against smurfs while leveling up. they wouldn't of learned much more than the absolute basics pre-30. 

Most friends of mine generally do well Pre-30 than when they hit 30 they hit a massive wall. I've had some want to 1v1 me just for laning experience and advice and none of them are ever prepared for the things I just do naturally. Seeing as how I'm currently sitting S4, (Tanked my promos and have went 5-2 since) I can't say your average fresh out of the box lvl 30 should be anywhere near Silver. 

There is just so much you need to know to be a below average player on top of having somewhat decent mechanics. 

You can also generally tell who a smurf is. I have like 150 wins - 65 loses on my smurf and most the games in my last 10 levels where vs lvl 30s, some where Gold, Plat and even a couple diamonds.
First placements game i did i got silver 4 and have never played a non flash game computer game before sooo

How long have you been playing LoL though?  Recently it takes half the time of before to reach lv 30.  That means players are hitting 30 with half the IP, aka half the champs, runes, experience playing the game, etc.  

Personally I got placed Silver 5 my first ranked season, but that was months after I hit lv 30.  I too had never been a moba player.  Heck, up to this point I played pokeman my whole life.  However I think that if I had gone straight into ranked I probably would have hit bronze.  High bronze maybe, but still bronze.

Remember that Bronze is the average for new players, that doesn't mean there aren't some outliers, especially if you have a talent for picking up new skills (Example I am very good at picking up skills quickly, I just rarely can bring myself to try and master them)

Bronze represents 30% of the ranked playerbase.  If you are in the bottom 30% of players then you play at a Bronze level.  You might occasionally push into Silver but you will fall back into Bronze.  A new player can be expected to on average fall into the bottom 30% of players.

Gonna have to call you out on an aspect of your first point, sorry.
Players will hit level thirty with half the IP, but they'll have the same amount of Champions as before, and not only that, people might have even more Runes.
Here's why. First of all, people will still need sixteen Champions to enter ranked. That number hasn't changed, and in fact, it is increasing because of the increasing number of bans. When I hit level thirty, I only had seven Champions. That number would have been lower if I had hit level thirty sooner, but I would have still needed to spend the same amount of time grinding up to the required sixteen Champions.
Secondly, players could jump into ranked without Tier Three Runes before. They could just hit the required Champion limit and jump into ranked. Since the required Champion limit is still the same (and is going up in the near future), players will still take the same amount of time to get those 16 Champions, and therefore still have the option to jump into Ranked without Tier Three Rune pages.
The reason why I say people might have more Runes is because Tier Two Runes were discounted shortly (two months) after the level requirements were changed. People can now easily jump into ranked with full Rune Pages, even though they're not Tier Three. Tier Three Runes don't provide much of an advantage over Tier Two Runes, anyways. Basically, it's easier for people to get the stats they need for ranked while it's still the same difficulty to get Tier Three Runes.

Really? Only 7 champions at lv 30?  I easily had 13-14 by that point and I just snagged up 2 450 ip Champs to get the 16 champions needed.  I also had a full tier 3 rune page at this point.  I then played like 2 ranked games before realizing I needed to practice more and didn't play ranked for a couple months.

Also although I didn't make it clear I don't believe owning 16 champions means you play 16 champions or you actually put effort into obtaining 16 champions.  This is due to the existence of 450 ip champions that are very easy to buy to reach 16 champions even if you never plan to play them.  I can personally say I did this. I played Annie, one of my first 16 champions, for the first time last year.  

The existence of 450 ip champions skews things because I know a ton of people hitting 30 buy them up for ranked because they take 2-4 games to earn.  As such I find players have X number of champions and Y number of fill ins for ranked, where Y is 16-X.  As such most new lv 30 players I meet only have X number of champions they wanted or know how to play, the rest are just for ranked.  450 champions are so cheap in comparison to other champions that they add a flat number of games required after hitting 30 to play ranked.  Changing how quickly one hits 30 changes how many 450 champions they need to buy, but 450 champions are so cheap that it only has a small effect on games needed.

Think of it this way:  Before to hit level 30 I had to play X games, lets say 100 for nice numbers as the actual amount doesn't really matter in this context.  Over that time I got Y ip to spend on champions that I wanted.  Lets call that 20000 ip.  That means I have 20000 ip to spend on champions that I want to learn right?  Well lets just say that gets us 10 champions.  We now need 6 more to play ranked!  Well the cheapest ones are only 200 ip compared to the average 2k ip of the ones I wanted.  Pre 30 I got 200 ip per game with a 2X ip boost.  That means to get 6 champions to play ranked I have to play 12 games.

- In this situation it took the player 112 games to meet ranked requirements. 

New situation, number of games to hit 30 halved.  This means I get to 30 after 50 games and with 10000 ip.  Instead of 10 champions I only got 5.  That means I need 11 champions to play ranked.  1 game still equals 100 ip and the cheapest champions are 200 so I need to play 22 games.

- In this situation it took the player 72 games to meet ranked requirements.  

(Please note that the numbers here are not accurate as they exist to present the math in a simple and easy to comprehend way.  Though actual values differ the results still show that 1/2 ranked time = less ip and less champions.)

--------------------------------------

It is human nature to want to achieve something as we complete steps towards it.  Getting to lv 30 means we can play ranked: regardless of our number of champions there is a good chance a player will want to try it right away.  They try to play and realize they need 16 champions.  They then take the shortest route towards getting 16 champions even if they aren't going to use the ones they are filling in for ranked.  This means that they would not own or play as many champions as they would if it took longer to hit lv 30.

The issue isn't that players are "not ready for ranked".  Players should be free to decided when they want to play ranked games because you can't require that players have an "idea of what they are doing".  There is no way to quantify that without having them play ranked games and actually show that they don't have any idea what they are doing.

Requiring that players play a certain amount before entering ranked play is reasonable and can help mitigate the issue (it will never remove it).  For example, a mastery requirement on 16 champions would go a significant way towards preparing players for ranked play, but even if RIOT implemented this, players would still show up lacking a lot of the skills you or others apparently take for granted.

TL;DR
The whole point of playing ranked is to sort players according to their skill.  You can't sort them according to skill before they even play ranked, because that would imply there is rank before you even play ranked.

When i first started playing back in s2  I knew i wasnt ready for a ranked game, so out of respect for the players that were ready I stayed out of ranked until I felt i was mechanically ready. Fast forward to today, I have played at the bare minimum 5 games a day every single day since I started. I missed two days back when my oldest daughter was born and even learned how to feed my little newborn baby AND play at the same time.  As a side note holding a baby while playing forces you to stay out of the rage zone and make DAMN good decisions, you never know when this kid is going to need a burp.

Anyways I waited a couple of years till I thought I was ready and decided to play my very first ranked game. I knew  I could win, i've played waaaay more than most people at my level and I was winning 90% of my normal games. Well I'll never forget that first game because it fucked me for ranked pretty hard. I decided that before I play ranked I win 500 games with the champ I'm most likely to win with (Ahri at the time) and I should absolutely dominate.  played about a thousand Ahri games was super confident. I put ranked on a pedestal and took it super seriously. I get mid,tell people to check my match history (hadnt lost an ahri game in 20 games) and proceed to get rofl stomped by the enemy riven. I will never forget this to this day, im in mid lane against leblanc who has been anything but easy since i cant land a single charm on her and this level 6 riven flashes out of top mid bush and stuns me, im SMASHING my r button, i get one dash off and then she wind slashes and kills me. We lost that game, and the Riven literally 1v4's us completely by herself without a single team mate and wins the game.

I decided I was still shit and all the time on ahri was essentially wasted since that time didn't produce a win. I hadn't warded the mid  bush and I paid for it. I decided that before I play another ranked game that I had to win another 100 games. league consumed my life, I read and studied everything league for hours and hours every single day. If I had a break at work, I was studying a champ and his counters, studying jungle routes and meta champs.

In the end, Ive played everyday for nearly 6 years, though ive never been placed bronze, I havent moved up a single division out of silver. Currently I am completely unranked with maybe 6 out of my 10 first games played. My friends think I can make it to diamond easy and they are always telling me im one of the best and I believe them since I feel like I have to carry every single game if I want to win any at all but the truth is that im in silver and ive never gotten out of silver despite all the practice and study ive put into the game. If I lose a ranked game I feel i deserve it, there is something I could have done better, maybe if i hadnt missed that one skill shot we could have won the game. To this day I don't feel like Im ready for ranked. I still lose games when someone like me should be winning them, I belong in silver, silver accurately describes my skill level and im ok with that.

To anyone reading this, I have one small bit of advice. Don't make the same mistakes I made, the MAIN reason I lost my ranked games is because I wasn't EVER  playing champs that were META or FOTM because of pride reasoning. I was a narcissist and i believed I was better because of my practice and game knowledge. You ARE NOT better than whats currently OP. BAN THE OP CHAMPS, dont do stupid shit like me and let them through because "practice and skill", BAN THEM. PLAY THE OP CHAMPS no matter how ugly they are, no matter how empty they make you feel after you dominate with them (wow thats so much easier than ahri). It's ok, lose that pride. It's literally how the pro's climbed to where they are, they played what was powerful, climbed, THEN practice other champs against opponents that are actually worth their time. This season I won't make the same mistakes, I will be leaving silver behind for good.

You shouldn't be able allowed to pick a champ in ranked that you aren't currently at least a level 4 mastery in.

This way people will have had time to learn their champ to a decent level, and they'll understand some of their mechanics, their counter plays, how to team fight, etc. 

This also disincentivises smurfs who will have to spend more time  to move up the ranks, ensuring that the people at any given rank are actually at that level of skill.

Furthermore, you should only be allowed to play ranked once you've got level 4 champ for 1 role in every lane/position.

This way you'll know how to play all roles, you'll understand all roles and how they work within the team. Then if you want to focus on only one or two positions, at least you'll understand the plight of your fellow teammate and not want to end up flaming them .

One of the problems is that Riot seems to be trying to diminish normal games/queues and push people into ranked more. With the removal of Normal Draft in most regions I think a lot of people resort to Ranked Draft as their everyday queue, because Normal Blind is just cancer.

Riot is intentionally trying to push more and more people into playing ranked, and now they're just flat out diminishing your ability to play anything else. So blame them for all of your inexperienced teammates.
